description:
Possibly the best thin crust pie in San Francisco. Pi Bar is a ritual for my girlfriend and me. It's never let us down, and I suspect it never shall. May it remain a hidden yet successful gem and never, ever change.

Pi Bar has a great rotating tap selection along with a good range of bottled Belgians. Also, their beer pretzels are sublime. Perfect appetizer to the 15" tomato pie.
author: Zach M.

description:
I'm from Chicago originally and know how good pizza is supposed to taste. I just moved to the neighborhood and wanted to try out Pi, since it's the sort of "pizza by the slice" bar you see commonly in Chicago and New York. I was pretty disappointed in what I received. The pizza slice had been reheated but the crust was too hard and dry, and the hard crunchiness of it overpowered the rest of the pizza. Sauce was pretty light on the slice too, so in my opinion a lot of flavor was lacking.

After four years of searching, I guess there really isn't a great pizza place in San Francisco at all.
author: Sean H.

description:
We live just down the street, so after 18 months of walking/biking/driving by every day, we decided to stop by for dinner. The beer list was impressive, but the food was immensely disappointing. 

We ordered a death by mushroom, which we found really light on flavor. Think low-sodium cream of mushroom soup on a pizza crust. The crust itself was just ok: thin but dense. Disappointing given the lengthy description of their crust on the menu.  Reminded of a DiGiorno or something else from the freezer aisle. 

The reason I felt driven to write this review, though, was the Caeser salad. I know this sounds hyperbolic, but it's not: I have never regretted ordering something more. For $15 you get lettuce that clearly comes from a bag, apparently mass-produced croutons, mediocre cheese, and a dressing that I never would have identified as Caeser. It was gross. We could barely eat any of it, and although the waitress/bartender noticed that we hardly touched it when she took away our plates, she didn't ask us about it. I know this is a lot of words dedicated to a terrible salad at a pizza place, but I want to impart how offensively bad and overpriced this thing was. I really hope they put some more effort in or cut the price in half.
author: Andrew B.

description: Poor service and passive aggressive bartenders. There are plenty of other places with mediocre pizza in the mission. I won't be back.
author: Ben D.

description: Great for a late evening slice - select all of your own toppings. Made to order. Fast and friendly service.
author: Vicki L.

description:
Quite a well-curated selection of about a dozen draft beers at any time and, as the name implies, decent pizza that you can get by the slice.

I had a couple of slices of sausage and meatball thin crust pizza and they were delicious. Normally, each cheese slice costs $4.50 (toppings 35 cents extra) and each pint costs $7-8 each, but if you can get here during afternoon hours (3.14-6.28 pm) their daily (including weekends) beer and a slice special (now $8.50) is unbeatable. 

Service is fast and efficient at the bar, and although there's a decent amount of room, it can get crowded during special events like Beer Week. A great place to have in the neighborhood.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Came on a Saturday night and it was pretty empty--we had a group of 8 people and were able to be seated quickly. We ordered a round of beers and two giant pizzas to share (large white pie, large mushroom pie). The beers were pretty good! Some nice IPAs, Ambers, etc. A bunch of my friends got the Petit Diablontin which is a sour and wasn't too bad either. 

The pizza took some time to come out despite not being super busy but it was tasty! The pizza was huge and the crust is SUPER thin--I think the mushroom one could've used a little more flavor in the mushroom sauce or something but otherwise it wasn't bad. Two pizzas was enough for the 8 of us but we also weren't super hungry so we barely finished.

Overall, a nice little place to check out but the pizza wasn't extraordinary. Craft beer selection isn't bad and service is okay overall. I might stop by in for happy hour in the future but it wasn't quite memorable for me and probably not my first choice for pizza or beers in the Mission.
author: Nerissa C.

description:
Pizza, pasta, and local craft beer done well.
Have whatever the daily special is cuz it's gonna be amazing. I've had spaghetti and lasagna, cooked al dente, with a flavorful sauce brimming with fresh veggies. 

The pizzas are thin crust so they're ready quickly. Death by mushroom is excellent.

Local sour beers and chocolate stouts are available on draft.
author: Mitzi G.

description:
Excellent slices -- house-grated Parmesan cheese though -- and a special every day. Thin crust and you just pay for whatever toppings you want. Yum. 

Excellent choice of beers and drinks. Really good. Lots of local choices. 

I often go here late to study. Lots of free tables and the service is awesome. 

Only thing that made me take a star off is it's pretty pricy. Maybe it's standard for SF these days. I just think a slice and beer should be cheaper than $20.
author: Erin H.

description: When I lived in the Mission District, I'd go here at least once a week. The servers are fun and hilarious, especially with the regulars. Great beer on tap, delicious pizza, and reasonable prices! What more could you want for a neighborhood pizza spot? Highly recommend getting there for the happy hour from 3:14 to 6:28 -- get the beer of the day and a slice of pizza for a steal! If you're looking to get a whole pie: get the death by mushroom -- it's divine!
author: Dani S.

description: Wish I remembered the name of the server who always treats my boyfriend and I like regulars, even if it's a month or two between visits. My usual: Blind Pig IPA, pretzel, a couple slices with bacon & sausage on top. Chill vibe in here. Pretty easy to get a seat. Excellent draft choices with some variety but reliable standards in draft always. Came in last on Pi day, so overdue for our next visit. Also, Sorry Bel didn't work out for y'all. See you here again, soon.
author: Michael M.

description:
Consistently good pizza and consistently excellent rotating taps of craft beers.  Friendly service, kid friendly, and a really good list of Belgian bottles you can take home!

Their happy hour special is a free slice of cheese pizza when you buy a pint of the beer of the day.  Awesome!
author: Kyle W.

description:
I enjoyed my experience at Pi Bar! Great beer selection, welcoming and friendly service, casual vibe and good food. We tried a few things on the food menu -- soft pretzel, meatballs, slice of pizza and rainbow cookies -- and enjoyed each of them.

The pizza is NY-style and well-executed. As someone born and raised in the NYC area I'm always on the hunt for NY-style pizza in the Bay Area, and was psyched to discover this place in my neighborhood. And come on, rainbow cookies?!

Prices for dinner were reasonable for the Mission. The happy hour beer and a slice special for $6.28 looks like a great deal as well.
author: Christine G.

description:
First of all, the best pizza in San Francisco. I will fight anyone who claims otherwise. Get a white pie with bacon (or mushroom), feta, and onion and thank me later.

Second, some of the best rotating beer taps in town. A few great fixtures and something new for everyone.

Last but not least, the best staff anywhere. The owners are here more often than not (working alongside their employees, not leaning over them), and anyone can feel like a regular the first time they walk in the door.
author: Michael H.

description: Solid beer but even better pizza. You can get a thin crush delicious slice of pizza for far too much money but it's damn good.
author: Rohan D.

description:
Quite possibly the most rude service I've ever encountered... Maybe enjoying the beer selection a little too much? Would've just left if I hadn't already caused such pain and hardship. When trying to order a pizza with multiple toppings, splitting the cost across 2 cards, the server about had a heart attack mid way through and ran back to the kitchen where she very audibly described me as "some a**hole" when cancelling my order. She then walked back, told me she couldn't do what I asked, at which point I gave up and proceeded to order an over-priced small pepperoni pizza ($25 ?!?) at which point she whined about having to "take the ticket way back to the kitchen again" (a solid 20ft walk). Should've just left in the first place.

Rating:
Pizza = A solid 4
Atmosphere = Same (4)
Value = 2
Service = 1

You do the math...
author: C B.

description:
3.5 Stars

Great NY-style pizza. Came here for an early dinner and just had to wait about 10 minutes to be seated at the communal table for our party of 7. 
We ordered 2 large pies. The first one was Death by Mushroom and added sausage.  The second was Cheese with Pesto and added bacon. I was afraid we wouldn't be able to finish it since it took up the majority of space on our table. But I was wrong! I guess all the guys in our party were hungry!) We also had the warm spinach salad, which had the right amount of sausage (small pieces) and made the salad flavorful.
I didn't get a chance to try the mushroom pizza, but tried the cheese with pesto and I liked it a lot. It had just the right amount of saltiness from the crispy bacon pieces.

The guys frequented the bar with their various selections of beer, which I heard was pretty good. Overall, a great place to get a pizza!
author: Mimie L.

description:
pizza is fair - i had the mushroom, which was ok (not enough flavor) and a slice with sausage and mushroom (homemade sausage also lacked flavor, which is kinda crazy to me).  i really love pizza (all types - thin crust and chicago style, fancy, cheap) and this was just not very good.  i wanted to love it! pizza was overpriced, too. the caesar salad was good but overpriced at $14.

they have a good draft beer selection and the vibe/servers are cool.  come here to have a beer, pizza is an afterthought.  didn't try pastas so can't speak to those.
author: Marisa A.

description: This is one of my favorite neighborhood spots in the mission. Great beer, great pizza and some of the best customer service in the area. Ali and James are two of the best bartenders, they always make me feel welcome and are very knowledgeable in the wide selection of beers on tap. 10/10.
author: Daniel P.

description: This place has the best pizza (west of NYC).  Nothing around here even comes close to it.   And the beer, well, its sort of a dream, if you like beer.  Great service. Great pizza.  Great beer.
author: Natalie R.

description:
Had dinner with a friend tonight because he was looking for Italian cookies.  I called all bakeries in the North Beach and no one made this.  Went on Goggle and there was an article in the SF Gate regarding the owner of the Pi Bar from New Jersey who had this in his menu for dessert!  We went in for the dessert and the meal we shared was great and delicious.  It is called the rainbow cookie!

We had the Polenta Fries to die for!!! Mixed green salad, their Wednesday night special fettuccine and a small 15 inch pizza with sausage and meat balls.  We had left overs on the pizza.  We rested a bit and then had our rainbow cookies.

Will be going back on a Thursday as they have a special lasagna!!!

Service was good.  Great place for family and children.  Great to also eat at the bar too.  Nice and bright with windows!
author: Stephanie C.

description: We ordered cheese pizza with toppings. They charged $3 for each topping, which seemed excessive. Ingredient choices were odd -- not black olives, but kalamata, not bell peppers but some other kind. The pizza was not cheesy or hot enough. The beer was not warm, but not cold either, and they were out of two kinds listed on the menu. Sorry, you seem like cool dudes, but with such a limited offering, it all could be so much better.
author: Sheviche R.

description: This place is okay... Their beer selection is pretty great but the food is ridiculously expensive for okay quality. We paid $15 each for a small block of lasagna that honestly wasn't that great. I feel like they're trying to be a gourmet/fancy pizza destination but falling short of the mark. Stop in for beer but maybe pass on the food!
author: Shirl Y.

description: Solid pizza and beer selection.  Their daily slice + beer special is great (although I think they may have recently raised the price), but otherwise can get somewhat pricey.
author: Riley D.

description:
Love. As a former Mission resident I relied on this place many-a-times to meet with friends for happy hour.

Great beer selection. 

Their pizza + a beer happy hour special can't be beat in terms of quality and quantity.

3:14pm-6:28pm is their happy hour -how fucking cute is that!?

People talk shit about how this place doesn't have "NY style" pizza... All I have to say is we are not in NY and the pizza tastes fucking good so what the heck, man? 

Staff is nice and this place is so close to BART it's easy to get to for happy hour on the weekdays.

If you want a local experience in the Mission this is a great option.
author: Taylor S.

description:
Dear Pi Bar: 

You have a totally awesome space. Cool neighborhood joint, nice crowd, good beer, and servers with just the right mix of friendliness and attitude. I really enjoyed being there. 

But I have to tell you, your pizza is seriously terrible. Your crust reminds me of the tombstone pizzas my mom used to pull out of the freezer when I was 8. I know you can better, and it wouldn't even need to cost you more - you just need to change up your recipe and technique.

I'm not saying this to be harsh, but because I would legitimately love to be your frequent customer. You would rock it as a great local pizza joint. But, you really need to up your pizza game. Let me know if you need a taste tester for new recipes and I'll be there.
author: Brad K.

description:
Very good selection of beers and ciders, both bottle and draft.  New stuff to try every week, not just the same 15 IPAs and Anchor Steam* I see at a lot of places. 

Pizza is excellent.  My wife and I order ours made extra crispy and they do it perfectly.  Not too thick, not too thin. Get the white pie, add some meatballs and garlic. 

*I like IPA and Anchor Steam
author: Michael R.

description:
I think I am being generous with the 1-star review.  For the second time in the last twelve months, I had a bad experience at Pi.  First of all, Pi hosted a SF Beer Week Event on behalf of Russian River Brewing, yet ran out of the signature Pliny the Younger and Pliny the Elder by 6 pm.

Second, none of the beer prices were posted or placed on any sort of placard.  I surmise my $31+ tab for three beers and two slices of pizza consisted of three $7 beers--two of them 4 ozs--and two slices of pizza plus tax.  I don't think I would have stayed as long or ordered as much food or beer had I known what it cost.

Third, the bartender forgot my order for two slices of pizza and seemed annoyed when I asked where they were.  

Finally, there were all kinds of signs asking for cash payment--indeed insulting those who paid with cards--in a very competitive neighborhood where credit and debit cards are the norm.  

So, although the pizza is excellent, the beer choices are inconsistent and often overpriced.  And, frankly, the service sucks!  Nothing about Pi, in my estimation, is welcoming.
author: Bo E.

description:
It's a good place with a variety of beers. Their pizza is better than a lot of other places in the area.
Their service, not so much. 
There were three of during my latest visit there, eating and drinking. We were still finishing our beers (half way) when we got asked if we wanted the bill. We said we are still drinking. We then were proceeded to be asked 4 times until we decided to pay and leave and think about never coming back. 
If a place has a limited time to use their chairs policy, they should make it clear. Or even a minimum purchase. Note that we were there for less than 45 minutes.
author: Jad A.

description: Get a slice of pizza and a glass of wine or local beer, and relax in this wonderful chill local's bar.
author: Tasha D.

description:
This place is small but tasty. I liked the dark ambiance. The jazz band that plays on some Mondays adds a really nice touch. They have really great beers and I also enjoy the Organic Pomegranate Cider. If you like sweeter drinks I definitely recommend this. We ordered the large White Pie (Mozzarella, Ricotta & Reggiano) and added sausage. The thin crust is perfectly crunchy and there were 8 HUGE slices. There are some unique toppings and ways to order your pizza, so there is something for everyone. There are about 6 veggie toppings. If you're into mushrooms you should definitely order that as a topping; they use portabello. They also have a few pasta and salad dishes. If you come on the weekend just prepare to have a bit of a wait or for a group of 2 it might be best to sit at the bar. Great pizza!

Pi "R" Square Special, 3:14 - 6:28pm Every Day
Single Slice and Beer of the Day for $6.28

Bonus: They are Zagat rated so you know it is worth at least giving it a try.
author: Morgan H.

description:
Simple, straightforward bar with no wait, good pizza, and some craft beer favorites. Big bonus is that they have Pliny the Elder bottles, so if you're in the mood but don't feel like making the trek to Russian River, Pi Bar lets you take as many as 4 of the big bottles home! 

The scene is a bit divey with a decently wide age range. There's good energy when I usually go on Fridays between 6-10 for dinner/brew. I'm not sure how this place fares for the late night 11-2 AM scene, but if you're looking for a place for conversation till the wee hours of the morning, I like how you can still talk here without losing your voice like in some other bars in SF.
author: Amanda A.

description: Good pizza and beer for a quick stop when passing by. Beer list could change more often though. Try the cheese pizza with balsamic onions, it's fantastic.
author: Max E.

description:
Great craft beer, cider and mead choices.
They have a distinguishing palate and always have some awesome brews on tap.

AND did I mention the Excellent pizza...

Ordered the mushroom and loved it. They put huge half moon slices of the whole portabello mushroom. Intense taste, crust had just the right balance of crunch and chew. Love this place.

Easily accessible from Bart station ( 1 block away) Will definitely return :)
author: Dan V.

description:
I've loved Pi Bar since it opened, and now I live a few blocks away, so I'm in heaven.

The beer selection is so good that my East Coast cousins had it on their list of destinations on their great California beer road trip.

The pizza is fantastic. I'm picky about pizza, and theirs is thin and crispy and flavorful. My standard is death by mushroom sauce with olives (fancy olives!). I've had days when it was a little less crisp than ideal, but I eat here every week or two and it's almost always great.

I can't believe it's not more crowded, but I won't complain. It's hard to find anywhere in the Mission to chill with friends without dealing with crowds, lines, and noise. Never change, Pi Bar.
author: Liana L.

description: What could be better than a bar with a great beer selection and some of the best pizza in SF!  The pizza here tastes different from anywhere else I've been (I've tried a lot of pizzerias) and stands out for sure.  The death by taxes mushroom sauce is a must try and the meat and veggie variety is A+ quality.  Crust is thin and the toppings don't overwhelm the pizza (perfect toppings to crust ratio.)   This is my go to spot now.
author: Mike V.

description:
Pizza and beer are the gems here.

I've been going to Pi Bar for a long time because I love the atmosphere and service. They host awesome breweries for beer week. But I recommend sticking to pizza or pretzels if you are hungry because when I've ordered entrees or other appetizers, they don't match the quality of the pizza.
author: Nann N.

description: Great east coast pizza, and great beer selection. Chill atmosphere where you can grab a slice and get a seat at the bar in a down to earth atmosphere.  With all the pretentious and overly expensive places in SF these days, it's great to have this option for great pizza and a chill vibe.
author: SF L.

description: This place is very good. I have lived within walking distance all my life and never bothered to check it out. Finally stopped by, it is very good. Beer selection and slices!
author: Jorge P. G.

description: Very good pizza, love the concept - thin and tasty hint of sweetish spice that I couldn't put my finger on.  Huge beer selection.  Decent wine.  Open friendly layout.  Large bar.   Opens at 3:14.
author: Jeff J.

description:
My roommates and I went here for dinner for girl's night. We were interested in this place only because we were craving pizza and because my roommate's last name happens to be Pi.

The place isn't that hard to find. They have a cute little sign with the pi symbol on it. Place itself is pretty big with a casual bar atmosphere. Workers are nice but kind of slow. Attentive while we're eating but not attentive while we checked our menus or after were done with our food.

We ordered a large cheese pizza ($20) with housemade sausage ($4.50) and mushrooms ($2.50) along with a side of polenta fries ($6). I decided to order the organic pomegranate cider ($8) for myself.

The cider was delicious. WORTH GETTING. 

Polenta fries were good and cutely assembled. I feel like there should have been more fries though.

Pizza was average. Would have been better if there was more flavor to it. We had to ask for some parmesan cheese so we could put it over the pizza. Great pizza doesn't need parmesan, but it is required for the pizza we ordered here. 

I would probably come back here more for the appetizers and the beer than the pizza.
author: Sofia R.

description:
Pi...as in 3.14?  Yes!

we got a recommendation to check this place out from the tavern in noe valley.  the bartender specifically told us to say that the "big, fat white guy recommended this place to us."  and low and behold, our server knew exactly who we were talking about.  haha. 

we each started off with draft beers...pretty decently priced.  then we moved on to the good stuff...food!  i love bars with food...it's like the best combination ever!  we started off with polenta fries and meatballs.  for our pizza, we ordered sausage and bacon.  

the polenta fries were yummy...served with a side of marinara.  i probably could've had the whole thing to myself!  the meatballs were ok...nothing to write home about...and then the pizza...the pizza was a little disappointing.  it's hard for me to put my finger on the problem...maybe it was the crust?  maybe it was the sauce?  all in all...it was just ok...the large pizza was disguised as an extra large pizza...super huge!  it took 5 of us to finish it.  

they also have a menu specifically for Belgian beer...with pictures, stories...everything!  impressive...but each beer was around $12...i found a few of these at whole foods for the same price but for a 6 pack.  but hey, bars can do that!

then a band started playing...they were jazzing out to the top 25 list...not bad...pretty cute actually.  

i wish they had a tv to broadcast sports games...then i'd probably just hand out at the bar rather than order food.  

oh, and i loooooooooooooooooved how they have a specific glass for every beer!  super personalized.  

solid 3 stars!
author: Jen W.

description: Great neighborhood place. Get the mushroom and sausage and a pomegranate cider. A small is plenty for 2 very hungry people or 3 regular people. Be careful with the large. It's... large.
author: Graham M.

description: Would not check food allergies over the phone because he was "too busy" to read the ingredients of the 50lbs flour bags they buy from an outside vendor. I stated that I have a severed soy allergy and this is the first and only place that refused to check that I have called prior to arrival. Terrible customer service!!!!
author: Divya P.

description: Great by and for the neighborhood joint.    Good beers for average prices, rotating selection. Nice slices, and cool staff! Love grabbing a couple slices and a couple beers in any casual night.
author: Americo P.

description: Very cute place! We got pesto sausage pizza, ciders/beers, and polenta fries, all of which were pretty good. The service was great (we sat at the bar) and it reminded me of a bar in Tahoe - cozy and super friendly :)
author: Amanda L.

description:
My husband and I were moving from the Haight to Bernal Heights. We were heartbroken to be leaving Toronado but Pi Bar made us feel less bad about it. The beer selection is excellent. Service is relaxed and friendly. Their food is their highlight. Loved everything we have had here. The sausage spinach salad is my personal fave and the white pie with onions is shockingly addictive.

Great for families, which is a little rare in this city.
author: Ge O.

description:
The place is pretty neat and how it plays off of Pi I went there this last Sunday. The inside is pretty unique as well though it's a pain to see the chalk board of beer selections when you're sitting on the bench side of the tables. The place though kind of smelled funky, I think it was coming from the tables...maybe they used a towel they were cleaning dishes/counters with to wipe down the tables which gave them a real funky smell. The service was slow even though there were only 10 people there...we had 8 people in a group.

Eh, the pizza wasn't that good. We had a large pizza with pepperoni on it. This place is somewhat over priced, yes the pizza was huge, but the extra toppings are super expensive. The daily special looked like it was from the day before. Also the beer wasn't the greatest, and the beer was actually kind of warm and disgusting. I'm not to sure if it was because they just opened for the day or what.

I probably will not be returning to this place because of the quality/pricing.
author: Nathan S.

description: The word is officially out about this great neighborhood spot. The beers on draft are superb and the pizzas are solid. I'm a huge fan of anything mushroom and their Death by Mushroom is tasty. The crust is thin and a large pie can be consumed by two hungry adults. (Truth.) Their happy hour is good, but this spot fills up with patrons seeking a good deal on artisanal ales so get there early or be willing to wait.
author: Lisa R.

description:
Pi Bar is a story of love and disappointment. I loved their beer selection! I headed to Pi Bar for the first night of Hannukah as they were pouring He'brew's Jewbelation 14 (which is absolutely delicious by the way). They're dedication to bringing in quality draft beers is really apparent as Jewbelation was just one of many fantastic brews on tap that night. 

So impressed by the beer selection we decided we had to try the pizza and ordered up the Death by Mushrooms. This pizza has so much potential has it mixes portebellos with Moonlight Brewing Co's Death & Taxes Beer. I'll give it to them, the toppings (mushrooms) were pretty good, unfortunately the crust on this pizza was awful, thin and bland, it's crust like this that gives California pizza a bad name, I really wished they had made a better crust because it could've been so much more.

Overall, 4 stars for the beer selection,  2 star for the pizza leaves us at a 3 star review. The specials looked like good deals, but I'd have to see what I thought about the other food before I really would want to take advantage of them.
author: Stephen S.

description:
Guess what time Pi Bar opens?

3:14 pm

Guess how much a slice of their cheese pizza costs?

$3.14

Grabbed a cheese slice and then added a couple extra toppings for $.25 each.  The crust was thin and crisp but I wished there was more cheese.  The roasted portabello mushrooms rocked but the raw garlic not so much.  Service was laid back and suited the casual, friendly, neighborhood vibe.  Next time I will definitely hit up some of their booze selections like the Pomegranate Ale.  We also liked Pi Bar's close proximity to Mission Pi(e) which is where we went for dessert. 

But my favorite part of Pi Bar was the unique decor: 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/d3KfHPRCscsm2gC884lsHg?select=-6gCRMazBWmhOkCJd_kg2A

Guess how many yelp stars I gave my first Pi Bar experience?

3.14
author: Amy C.

description: Food is great. Pizza that makes me super happy! Staff... Rude. Rude on my phone call, rude when I got there. The way I was just treated makes me want to be a nicer person - to everyone. So I guess that was a positive experience.
author: Leslie B.

description: I always had a great time at Pi Bar. They always have great pizza - the mushroom pizza is my favorite. Seats can be hard to find in the evening, but there is a communal table.
author: Sadique A.

description:
Full disclosure: I used to memorize digits of pi, so my review may be biased. 

Great pizza and beer (12 drafts for mostly 6/7 dollars) + chill atmosphere and good music.

They provide oregano, chili flakes, hot sauce and pepper if you want to spice up your pizza. 

They also have a daily deal from 314-628 pm: pizza + beer of the day for 7.22
author: Jonathan H.

description: The food is great. The male servers are very nice. The tall brunette, however, is consistently rude to the point of us not wanting to go in when she is working.
author: Eme C.

description: The absolutely most splendiferous craft beer bar in the city. Jenn the proprietress is well known in beer circles and she puts on a great vibe here at this "Pi-centric" craft beer and pizza parlor. They're always serving something special- at times its Russian River Plinny the Younger and other times it's North Coast Prankster. Come live your beer fetish fantasies with great slice.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Artisan pizza with craft beer?

Why yes, thank you : )

A fellow member of my Meetup Group, Sara G., wearing a Pi Bar sweat shirt, recommended this bar after I randomly bumped into her at an event, so off we went!

First, I really liked the location in The Mission -- on Valencia at 25th Street -- on the edge of Cole Valley, it's in a quieter part of the neighborhood.

Second, a chill venue with an awesomely cool waitress who quickly and adeptly gave us a run down on the beers that they have posted on a chalkboard on the far wall.

I opted for an excellent Belgian brew, which I was quite fond of the more I drank it. Smooth, with a good body and nice head, I would have sampled another Belgian in their selection if it hadn't been near closing time.

Third, mouth-watering, high quality slices of pizza pie for only $3.14 (um, if you don't know what the name of the bar is referring to when you see this price, then you should review your high school math textbook).

The optional toppings are worth the extra 25 cents. I chose the Portabello Mushroom which turned out to be a "meaty" selection that added a lot of flavor to the slice.

Thanks for the tip Sara G.!
author: Diana V.

description: Cute place! First of all I love the concept (open at 3.14 PM every day, heh) and the bar itself is a nice space. I went there around dinnertime, and there was a good amount of people without being too crowded. I sat at the bar and got a dark beer (Moonlit Death + Taxes, I believed it was called), a slice of cheese pizza topped with mushrooms and parmesan, and rainbow cookies (A+). The wifi was pretty fast (have you seen a girl with her laptop out at the bar lately? That was me) and the bartender was super nice. Would recommend, would visit again.
author: Ava H.

description:
Slice of pizza + pint of beer for $7... count me in!

Two of us happened upon this place while waiting for another friend to finish up at a cafe nearby. We both needed a little something to hold us over until dinner and Pi Bar was the perfect solution for that. The pizza was pretty good quality and a cold pint of beer was perfect for the chilly afternoon.

Would definitely be my neighborhood place if I lived close by. Hope you all make it that too!
author: Raina B.

description: Meeting up with friends in the mission or just wanna grab a slice and a brew? This is your spot. Veggie pizza is really good. Staff is always friendly. Beer week participant
author: Gustavo C.

description:
Great neighborhood bar and dinner joint!  Good selection of beers, good food, and the bartenders are the best - super friendly and welcoming!

Pizza is better if you order a full pie.  By the slice, it's good, but a purpose built, full pizza is the jam.

Beer selection generally lacks stouts and porters, but has gotten better as of late.

Stromboli special on Tuesdays are great; they usually have 2 on the board.  Lasagne on Thursday is awesomely ample and delicious; very cheesy.  Meatballs are awesome too.

Ignore the haters complaining about beer week. Those guys are the same amateurs that make bars annoying on the weekends.
author: Sam A.

description:
I would give this place 3.14159.... stars for their creative name of the place and the fun they have with the opening hours at 3:14pm each day.  I actually wish to give them 4.5 stars because they have elements of 5 stars, but the Za is only 4 stars compared to other pizza places I've reviewed.

The beer list is 5 stars... very great rotating selection.  Too bad they were out of the Anchor Christmas Ale 2012 (keg finished the day before), but I got to try several interesting selections.

Service is great, very efficient and friendly.

The pizza was very tasty too, nothing fancy, just good stuff.  Not a wood fired, coal fired, or crazy crust... just a nice medium crusted flavorful creation that matches well with the beer.   I highly recommend this place.
author: Dan M.

description:
Tasty thin crust pizza and a revolving selection of craft beers like O.B.C. Sticky Zipper? Oh, don't mind if I do.

The Monday special "Death By Mushroom" pie alone is worth the trek to the outskirts of the Mission.

The bartender/server was a-ok. I think we related to each other on a very bearded level. I gave him a look like "I get you, bro" and he nodded his head like "for sure, dude" and then everyone got beer and pizza!

I mean I didn't get a back rub or anything but I think he might have considered it if I asked.
author: Stephen C.

description: I love coming here every couple months. the pizza is good, friendly service. Nice casual atmosphere.
author: Cody H.

description:
Date & Time:  Thursday October 1, 2009 @ 7pm Opening Day
Company:  Michael
Crowd:  Packed w/ Chenery Park Regulars
Wait Time:  Approx. 45 Minutes
Atmosphere:  Social
Decor:  Rustic & Inviting.  ChalkBoard w/ Beer Selection.  Communal Table & Bench-Seating for Deux
Service:  Nice & Efficient
Imbibe:  Draft Beer of The Day & Black Cherry Soda
Devour:  Fried Mozzarella & Hand Thrown Thin Crust Pizza Made w/ Organic, Sustainable & Local Ingredients:  HouseMade Italian Sausage & Portabello Mushroom
Total:  $48.73
author: Genevieve Y.

description: Really!???  77.58 for a large pizza and Ceasar salad.  Yeah, and I'm a freakin millionaire!  Hey Pi Bar?  Just shut down.  I will happily yell everyone I know to boycott you.  You guys are insane.
author: Mike C.

description:
First of all, I would add another half star if I could - just for their logo. 

Pi Bar gets labeled as one of the "beer bars" in the Mission, and that's why we went there. It's not the "50 beers on tap" type of beer bar, so pump your brakes. Instead they have a carefully curated and well-balanced list of beers waiting to be served by a laid back and friendly bartender. 

If you're looking for a nice place to sit and enjoy a good beer, Pi Bar is worth checking off your list. It's a great place to start a date, but didn't seem like a place to stay for dinner. The pizza looked alright, but if you're at Pi Bar you're already close enough to Pizzeria Delfina where it wouldn't make any sense if you didn't go there for your pizza. 

With my beer I ordered a pretzel - served with some homemade beer mustard that was better than the pretzel itself. Regardless, that pretzel was just enough to hold me over until dinner.
author: Marcus C.

description: Delicious pizza and great beer! My fiancé and I stopped by this place on a Tuesday evening looking for a place to eat, have a drink and finish up some work. This was the perfect place. Ample seating and awesome vibe. Will be back for sure, the pizza is delicious!
author: Chauanh D.

description:
It's okay, but a bit of a rip-off when it comes to value.  Some of the beer comes in a smaller glass that should honestly come in a pint.  I realize that some beers come in specialty glasses, but they just do it to rip you off here.

The food is okay, but there is better pizza within walking distance.  The beer is okay, but the same beer is available for cheaper in adult-size glasses within walking distance.

It's pretty quiet though, and that is nice.  I go here expecting to get ripped off when I want to chat quietly with some friends.
author: Justin T.

description:
Came here for Russian River brew day on beer week.  It's well located in the Mission, relatively clean, and has great service (unlike some of the other spots in the Mission who think they are doing you a favor when you give them money for a drink).

Not sure about the prices for everything else, but the Russian River stuff was $6, which was just $1 a little more than Toronado.  So five stars.
author: Daniel Y.

description: Such a cute and comfortable environment.  The service was amazing, extremely nice and accommodating.  The pizza was AMAZING - we had the white pizza with homemade sausage and portobello mushrooms, they also have amazing homemade hot sauce. Definitely one of my favorite places in the city, so happy I came across it.
author: Jaclyn K.

description: I've been to Pi Bar 3 times now, and the experience has been great each time.  They have a good draught selection and varies.  If I had a small complaint about this place is that they quit offering the sour beer that I loved the first time we visited.  If you're a food snob looking for some kind of artisan pizza, you're going to be disappointed.  This pizza reminds me of New York slices - flavorful toppings and blend of spices and cheeses, but the crust isn't going to wow you.  I actually dig the crust though.  Our last trip was with another couple, and one 21" pie with a few toppings, about 5-6 beers total came to around $100.  That's not bad at all for the quality of the craft brews and their selection on top of the good pizza.  Service has been top notch as well.  If you're into quirks - they also open at 3:14 every day.  Get it?
author: Scott S.

description:
"Quality beer, ok pizza, (almost) zero pretense"

The reason pretentiousness is a concept (in a context of a food establishment) is the benefit it yields in speed of discerning quality. The problem with it is that it is not very accurate. 

Pi bar straddles the line - it brings quality beers, and decent pizza, without being pretentious about it.  Well it probably is pretentious by Mission standards. 

Yeahbutstill. 

Pi bar works great for when you need a good beer and a decent slice with minimal tude in a minimally pretentious setting.  This pizza wont beat (or even compete with) pizzetta, little star, or delfina, but if you believe that beer is an integral part of the pizza experience, the whole package just might. Easily a 4 star +.
author: Oleg H.

description:
Pi Bar is a chill eatery in the outer mission. It's further down the road from all of the action on Valencia, so parking isn't too hard to find. We had some beer, a couple slices of pizza, an order of polenta fries and a garden salad and it came out to about $40, which is kinda pricey for what it is.

The polenta fries, like everyone says, are awesome. They also have a great selection of beer on tap. And the Pi concept, $3.14 happy hour specials are fun too. The only thing that was disappointing was the pizza--maybe ours was overcooked, but it was hard and tasted like cardboard. There wasn't any sauce on the pizza either...

If you come here, I'd stick to the beer and polenta fries, and skip the pizza. There are much better pizza places elsewhere in the city.
author: Lisa N.

description: Cute place. A bit small, so it gets crowded quickly. Lots of beer on tap.
author: Patrick S.

description:
flavorless crust, sauce, unimaginative pizza. expensive beers.

skip it
author: Jenny C.

description:
I love, love, love this place. Where else can you get a slice of really good, sit down pizza for $3? 

The decor is warm, wooded and tasteful. Sort of casual, sport-bar type atmosphere without the blaring TVs. For a beer bar, they also have a good selection of moderately priced, fresh wines, which I really appreciate. 

When I go I always get a slice of cheese pizza and the baby green salad. If you're a meat eater I'd recommend the housemade italian sausage as a topping, it's amazing and I miss it. On Monday's you can get Death by Mushroom pizza by the slice, which is basically the best thing ever.

Service is zip fast, a great place to eat if you're in a bit of a hurry. Even when it's packed to the gills I still get my pizza and salad within 5 minutes of sitting down.

The place is small so I would not recommend it for large groups, but it's a perfect place for meeting up with a friend or a date. 

The only downside is it's not open at lunch time!
author: Meagan F.

description: The portions are huge and flavor is decent, but it's overpriced. They also charged me $3 more than the price listed on yelp and acted annoyed when I kindly pointed that out.
author: Drew M.

description:
I came here yesterday with a friend for the Deschutes Brewery event for SF beer week. We first stopped by ~ 7ish, but could barely get through the door, so we ate dinner elsewhere and came back for beers.

We had the hop henge, inversion ipa, armoury xpa, pinedrops ipa, and another ale i can't remember the name (sf grizz?). All the beers were pretty good and the bartenders were nice and knowledgeable.

My friend lives a block away, so it's a default place to grab a couple beers if we're feeling too lazy to walk further out into the Mission. It's definitely lower key on this side of the Mission, so parking is usually easier.
author: Kenny J.

description: I like the concept of a 3.14 p.m. opening, and the space is clean, airy.  There's beer and food, but, honestly, can't rave about either.  Not so atmospheric as other places.  The bartenders aren't as engaging.  Finally, there's a 'chill'--not a good one--to the place that doesn't promote coziness, quirkiness, or variations thereof that make a bar or restaurant of this type memorable.
author: Poet D.

description:
Pi bar has authentic New York style pizza--a rarity for the West Coast. Ingredients are fresh, and the dough is amazing. Get some polenta fries alongside your slices. 

The beer is stellar. Clean lines and fresh beer on draught. Pi bar also has a great bottle menu. Tons of delicious Belgians and local beers.

Bottom line: if you don't like Pi bar, you don't like life.
author: Alex F.

description: Pi Bar is a nice, small pizza joint located near the Mission. I came here on a Saturday night with two of my friends and was very amused by how this restaurant plays up their "pi" theme. (For example, they open at 3:14 pm everyday.) The interior is pretty dim and what you expect from a bar. We were seated pretty quickly, and the service staff was very courteous and attentive throughout our entire stay. We ordered two pies: mushroom and pepperoni. Despite the pizzas being very greasy, I thought that it was pretty standard and what you would expect -- nothing too special. For the reasonable price and decent food, I will be back next time I am in the mood for pizza.
author: Hurnan V.

description: The woman (who looks like the owner) is not friendly looks like someone forced her to work there. We ordered a simple cheese pizza- Took forever- and came burnt as hell and the topping was so overcooked it blended into the sauce you couldn't find it. The place is called pi for God sakes! We asked for a check after 2 bites- the woman didn't even ask why.. Because she couldn't care less. And on top of that bill was $30 for nasty pizza and ONE beer. I don't go to places that don't care about customers- we walked out and went to another place. I gave 2 stars only because for a beer it's fine.
author: K G.

description:
The only thing that is saving this place from a no star is the food. The pizza is one of the better ones I've had in the city.  And they have good beer, I recommend the tangerine wheat and I'm not much of a beer person so I think that says something. 
The service is absolutely horrible. I went on a Tuesday night with some of my girlfriends and the staff barely acknowledged us. It took them forever to get take our order (for pizza and drinks). No greeting, no smile, barely any eye contact. On top of that, they charge 20% gratuity for large groups, which to me is pretty absurd for the treatment that you get. Not to mention 20% is a lot, most places that I've experienced usually charge 17-18%
author: Caroline C.

description: I liked this place! You can order by the slice (around $4) or a whole pie ($20-30). Happy hour deal is a beer + slice for around $7. Get the thin crust instead of Sicilian, which is really dense.
author: Small W.

description:
A casual and laid back kind of bar. Bring your friends because its good for groups, but come early in the night on the weekends.

Great beer selection on tap, especially from local microbreweries. Russian River, Anchor, Bear Rebublic, Heretic.

The Death by Mushroom pizza was tasty but not amazing. Its great for the thin crust lovers out there, but cannot compare to Little Star. A bit pricey too.

Parking is easy and they take credit card!
author: Alfred L.

description: This is a good place to have a beer if you have children. The beer selection is good but a little pricey and the staff are mostly friendly. The place has a nice pseudo bar feel if you want to have an early drink with friends and bring the kids for pizza. The food is just okay but the place has other things going for it, including a non pretentious crowd and no line around the block. The credit card minimum is rather high. Overall, this is an easy place to go to.
author: Sophia L.

description:
There are better thin-crust pizzas to be had in the City and there are bars with more impressive selections of beer. That said, Pi Bar is a great spot to enjoy a pizza and have a few delicious beers. I have been a few times and each time I leave satisfied. 

Last time I was there, I had a Avec les Bons Voeux and a plain cheese pizza--a very enjoyable combination, which alone is worth a visit.
author: Steven W.

description:
Pi Bar...

Yes, Yes and Yes!

So the mission starts with 2 friends and I at Philz coffee and are debating on where to eat.  So we think, let's stay somewhere local and I randomly say, we're probably ending up somewhere in the mission.  Then one of my buds say, "let's go to Pi bar, like the the symbol, 3.14" and I'm like okay...So we start our journey unaware of the location and this is where I start hating life, (BTW I hate walking).  Anyhow as we reached our destination, we're totally dying of hunger.  As we enter the doors, I'm thinking, okay, this is going to work...

Starters:  I had a Tiburon, my friend a Pilsner and my other friend the Pom Cider...(not bad)

The food:  As the polenta fries come out, I actually wanted to eat the whole thing, but remembered I needed to share, YUM! you need to try.  We also had a side of meatballs and a Large Sausage Bacon Pizza, YUMMMMMM!!!! sigh...

We ask for the Beligian beer list and of course I order a Framboise, oh yummy goodness, at this point, I was so consumed with my own beer that I wasn't paying attention to anyone else and 3 more friends trickle in.  More beer comes to the table, the Pizza devoured and out of the blue a band starts playing and I'm like, what is happening??? Any band with an upright bass is good in my book.  This is awesome!  As the band finishes their polka tune they start playing the Gorillaz "Clint Eastwood."  As this sets everyone in a good mood, you can feel it's going to be a good night for everyone...

Pi Bar. 12 Thumbs up (that's all 6 of us lol)

But the Yelp mission isn't over...off to Humphrey's!
author: Edrian D.

description:
What made me fall in love with this place?
***The Pi Bar Special***
come by between 3:14 to 6:28pm every day to get a craft beer (rotates daily) and a slice of cheese for $6.28.

Does any other craft beer centric place have a food/beer happy hour offering? Exactly. Every sophisticated day drinker knows the party only lasts as long as you maintain a proper balance of booze-water-booze-food-booze-water.

The bartenders are good people. Not the typical, our-shit-is-hella-cool-don't-you-know that can happen at some spots in SF of this quality. If it's slow and you come back, they'll probably get to know you by name. If it's packed, they don't mind hustling around to keep everyone happy.

They rotate 12 kegs of craft beer. Rotate. 12 kegs. They do.

When you are hungry from all those high gravity $6 craft beers, they offer a slice of cheese for $3.14.

Simple. Elegant. Kind of like mathematics. Pi Bar is five star.

P.S. The papers say it's a "Great casual date spot that says, 'I'm classy. I'm American. I like good beer and pizza.'"
author: Benjamin W.

description: Blatantly my favorite place for beer in San Francisco! The people working there are always friendly and helpful about the flavors, offering tastes, and recommending what is new or you are likely to enjoy. They update their taps regularly and have very reasonable prices and decent pizza if you fancy a bite to eat too! They also post their daily beer board to Twitter each day so you know what is available in advance! Awesome if you're hunting down a place to get Fort Point Westfalia that week :-)
author: Nik Y.

description: Pi Bar is such a great place. The pizza + beer special is out of this world. The cheese on that pizza is so light and fluffy it blows my mind. Great craft beer choices on tap all the time too, thumbs upp.
author: Jason M.

description: Worth traveling hundreds of miles just for the lasagna and the great service. And death by mushroom pizza a close second. I hear they serve great beer too!
author: Craig S.

description:
What's with the shade, Yelpers?
Pi Bar is f*cking great!

They have a daily slice special and an expertly curated beer menu, most of which is rotating. Can't decide between two different IPAs? Your waiter will bring you two adorable samples in tiny, tiny beer mugs.

Service is so friendly and attentive here. My buddy and I stayed for almost 2 hours, just chatting and drinking pints. I had a slice of the Sicilian, which was a great beer drinking snack. 

On a Sunday night, there was plenty of seating. It's a very inviting lil spot.

Look for the Pi symbol outside! It's easy to miss.
author: K M.

description:
Super quaint! (Yeah, quaint. I said it. I'm bringing it back.)

The death by mushroom pizza was yum. Non-traditional, but yum!

Beer was good- loves me some microbrews. 

Live music on monday ROCKS.  A cute spot for things I don't go on (dates).
author: Emily D.

description: This place is ok. Kind of a 50/50 cross between a bar and a restaurant. Pretty casual place to hang out.
author: Henry L.

description:
This place is solid and comfortable, the kind of place to hang out with friends who just want to kick back with decent beer (or wine) and some pizza. 

I think the reason this place gets rated 3 stars is that it is NOT the hottest, most amazing crust from the future star chefs who are perfecting their wood fired thin crust pizzas. 

I love those places on Valencia and scattered throughout San Francisco, but "Pi Bar" is more like the place you go out to hang out and NOT wait in line for 45 minutes to get a table. Actually, if you look at the Ambience recommendations on Yelp - it is not romantic, not classy, not divey, not hipster, not touristy, not trendy, not upscale.

Therefore, if you're judging Pi Bar as a solid, laid back, unpretentious place to drink and eat well and hang with friends, it gets 5 stars!
author: Michael R.

description: Solid neighborhood spot. Great service, great beer!! Best NY pizza in the mission by far! Hate to say it but puts beretta food to shame.
author: Lenny K.

description:
Nice spot to meet up with people. Service was slow - I imagine if we sat at the bar it would be better. The server tried very hard to get me to order beer instead of wine. I don't like beer - after explaining this a few times he brought me a taste of one he was sure I'd like. I didn't like it -but I give him props for trying. I did like the wine. 

Still - it's a nice spot to meet up with people.
author: Teresa J.

description: Food was really good. They kinda made a scene when we decided to split the bill four ways.
author: Felipe Q.

description: The pizza here is ok ~ the atmosphere  always seems to be loud n noisy due to all the noe valley people who bring their noisy kids along~ but for the area it seems to be the best pizza. I guess I would recommend this spot to parents with noisy kids.
author: Duke Of Frisco X.

description:
This place is great!  Best pizza I've had in SF.  TIP:  Get a whole pizza... much better than slices. 

The bartenders are great.  The beer is tasty. They have an extensive beer list that is actually affordable (unlike Monk's Kettle).

Best of all, it has a distinct non-hipstery vibe.  It's not pretentious, just good.
author: Mark B.

description:
I have consistently been treated 
in a rude manner
By the people who work here.

Finally after the last visit
I got it!

I am never going to eat or drink there again!

Life is too short to suffer surly wait persons 
who don't give a damn!
author: Lynda Beth U.

description:
Devastatingly good. My friend ordered a large pizza for the three of us and I had my doubts but didn't want to make a fuss and remained quiet wondering what I would do to satiate my hunger. When the pizza arrived I was astonished by its size. It was about the size of a trash can lid, WOW. Had a sausage and onion pizza and it was truly to die for. I wish that I could fully express how amazing the pizza was, I'm just not fluent enough in English to convey the delight I felt eating it. I will return. Run, do not walk to this place.

Also, a great selection of tasty sodas. I had the cherry soda and it was akin to drinking a bottle of liquid maraschino cherries. Yum.
author: Marc M.

description:
A true local bar/pizza joint, Pi Bar fills a niche in the outer Mission, but isn't worth a special trip.

More bar than restaurant, Pi Bar has only five regular tables and the all-too-common communal dining area up front. Decor is strictly dive: ceramic tile floor, oak bar, and too-bright track lighting.

The menu is simple--a few salads, a few pre-configured pizzas, and a list of ingredients with which to create your own pi ... er, pie.  Slightly over-dressed, the spinach salad with toy box tomatoes ($10) delicately balanced the saltiness of a sprinkling of feta with the rich smokiness of copious amounts of housemade Italian sausage.  Delicious, the polenta "fries" ($5) disappeared all too quickly.

Somewhere between wood fired thin crust and Chicago deep dish, the pizza at Pi Bar is undistinguished. While made with quality Guisto's unbleached organic flour, Pi's crust is medium thick--neither crispy, nor soggy, neither delicious, nor cardboard-like. Better than Domino's and Extreme, Pi's pie pales in comparison to Pizzeria Delfina or Tony's.

Friendly and attentive, service was better than one would expect in a neighborhood bar-come-pizza-joint. With more than 12 craft beers on tap and a reasonable selection of wines by the glass, patrons have sufficient selections to wash down their pie.
 
Any place that bases its existence on a geeky double entendre (pi the irrational number and pie for the pizza) deserves kudos for wittiness. However, the pizza from Pi doesn't warrant resurrecting Archimedes.
author: CJ G.

description:
ok last update....#?

I should finally just add the damn yelp app and use quick tips according to about 3.14 friends.

So... I was introduced to their meatballs recently by sharing a (generously sized) meatball sandwich with a friend.  Holy Good Lord Baby Jesus. And I thought the homemade sausage was off the hook...

then I tried these little buggers on a slice with some very hoppy beer of the day. WOW.  And I'm not talking about the beer!!  The meatballs must be made with some kind of edible crack.

MUST. TRY. MEATBALLS. ( hashtag that shit if you're a twitter.)
author: Athena S.

description:
Cute spot in the mission packed to the brim with other SF beer week connoisseurs.

Like most of the reviews of late, I can reiterated that it was crowded, they seem to have a shortage of staff at least in terms of the beer week crowd (I saw two bartenders and one person bringing out food from the kitchen).
I would have been interested in food but I couldn't find a host or menu or sign in sheet...so I'm guessing the tables are first come first serve. 

Bummed they ran out of Pliny beer so quickly, but I've heard they have a good selection normally so I'd definitely check this place out again for a drink.
author: Nikki M.

description: Pizzas whole or by the slice.  Funny specials and happy hours that are expressed as multiples of pi.  Cozy enough to swing by but not so cozy that you stay long.  Seems they got this formula right.
author: David S.

description:
This is a great neighborhood beer bar.  The folks behind the bar are friendly and attentive, good selection of suds to imbibe and what better accompaniment to beer than NY style pizza that you can have by the slice or the whole pie.

Great place to hang on a Sunday night if you want to avoid the hordes at places like Berretta.

Cheers!
author: G R.

description:
Sat at the bar on a Sunday, the bartender came down and broke out their beers on tap for us. We tried some samples, she was very friendly and knowledgeable about the beers available. Finally settled on a pomegranate cider that was crisp and fruity.  They always have a $6.28 beer and food special - on Sunday's its Sicilian Pizza. Wasn't bad, although there are better options on the food menu. 

One of the best Caesar salads in the city, made with fresh dressing and balanced flavor. The polenta fries are also delicious. 

No TV, casual environment, kid friendly early in the evening. They also open early, for the neighborhood, so a great place to grab a beer and appetizer before heading down Valencia.
author: Darren K.

description:
Terse bar keep, says he is too busy to take care of me. He says he hopes the next time is better! I asked for two slices of Death by Mushrooms. They were so burned up they had to be returned. There answer was: they will take them off the bill. No other options or replacement! Ok you aren't ready to provide a repast! This means, relax with service and respect!
Yes, you are not the only best thing on this plant! Maybe my next experience will be somewhere that they are ready to provide a good sharing of service! Look "bartender" this was a Monday early evening! What happens to your disposition when there is a real demand for service?
author: Art R.

description:
Another reviewer mentioned a sense of coldness about the place and I think that is true. I ate with friends so didn't notice at the time and it was a good place to meet and catch up. The service was friendly and attentive and divided the check for us (I picked up the pizza). Beer selection was good and reasonably priced.

I got the Death and Taxes pizza. Honestly, nothing much stood out in the sauce, just the mushrooms themselves. The crust was thin, which is great, but too board like and dry. I probably should have gotten the red sauce since that is the standard to measure against, but I am not sure I will eat here again. Maybe a slice.
author: Robert T.

description:
Come for the beer, don't stay for the food.  

The the pizza is a bust - Pi Bar's bland over-priced pizza is a total waste of calories.  I don't care about having a perfect hand-crafted-organic-wood-fired-pizza, but I do care about getting a tasty slice...and this place doesn't hold a candle to your average New York neighborhood joint.  To add insult to injury, the 40 bucks we shelled out for a fairly standard mushroom pizza is waaaay too much...and I love mushrooms.  

The beer is good - they have a nice selection with good prices.  $6 for a Russian River pint is worth a star on its own.  Setting the pizza aside, this is a pretty solid beer bar - lots of space, decent music, and unpretentious wait staff.  

Overall verdict: three stars for a solid beer, zero stars for blah pizza, and minus one star for charging too much for said blah-ness.
author: Rosers M.

description: Great beer selection. The atmosphere is casual and nice. Pizza was delicious.
author: Kyle K.

description: awesome chill place. Great pizza, lovely bartenders. We just moved to the neighborhood from Baltimore and have been looking for low key non tech bro spots - this bar is great. Can't beat the happy hour pizza +brew deal.
author: Aley T.

description:
3.5 stars

I went to Pi Bar in my continuing search for real New York pizza. Along with comedy, bad accents, and bagels, pizza is one of the things that NY unequivocally produces better than California does. (On the plus side, California lacks Staten Island, JFK, and service people who could all be taught a lesson in courtesy by the DMV). 

The pizza came very close to real NY pizza. I was impressed by what I could see of the process as the chef shoveled thin crust pizzas into the pizza oven. My only disappointment was that the crust had gotten a tiny bit soggy in the middle--it came so close to real NY pizza with its thin but chewy crust that remains crisp on the very bottom. But I would definitely be willing to come to Pi Bar to try again.  A healthier salad selection would also be nice.

Pi Bar's weakest point is the atmosphere. I'm not sure that it quite knows what it wants to be. It looks like a bar and feels like a bar; the pizza seems almost like a not-totally integrated side business. Pizza joints are usually slightly loud, warm, fun places that invite large groups and families. We went on a Monday night, so it might have just been slow, but with the dark (if attractive) bar decor, Pi Bar lacked that inviting quality. The ceiling is cool, however. 

Service was friendly and the beer list was good. Overall, Pi Bar shows promise.
author: Susan S.

description:
Overpriced and not great.
I was there with a girlfriend of mine before Christmas. The space is open, a bit too dark... the lady who served us was very nice.

BUT.... you can be nice as much as you want, if the Pizza is not too good, you do not want to come back. I actually order out a while before and I got almost disgusted form the pesto pizza I got when I tried to eat it at home. 

As almost everything was closed on the 24th Dec... I said " Well.. let's give it a try and see if eating pizza on site is better" :)

Well.. it is better, you can at least eat it, but NO WAY closer to any of the pizza places you can get in the Mission.. and in SF in general.... AND ... it is not cheap at all. The BASE pizza is not expensive, but that is only the dove ... yes.. you need to pay for every single topping / ingredient you add.

The crust was okaysh .... but the oven is an old electrical one.. not good... I really felt the pizza did not get the right blast of heat.

The result... naaaa... no more. Sorry guys.

Hipster atmosphere.... it is cool... lots and lots of beers to choose from (that is why I give you 2 stars instead of 1).
author: Gianguido G.

description: This is  a great place.  The pizza was delicious, and the beer selection was amazing.  The bartender that helped us was laid back and really cool.  But the reason for this review is for that amazing spinach salad with the housemade sausage.  ($14).  It was now on my list as one of the top salads in the city.
author: Matt W.

description: Good selection of beer but very slanted towards IPAs. Had the pretzle and sicilian and both were quite meh.
author: Will D.

description: Love this place. Cute n cozy. Neighborhood bar, they have pretzels. Good atmosphere and definitely the place to drink beer in the mission / SF. Go try this place, you will like it.
author: C A.

description: Decent pizza and craft beers (I'm not into crafts and microbrews personally). If you like simple things this is your place.
author: George L.

description:
Having been to Pi Bar on several occasions, ordered their entire lineup of brew, and partook in the fresh pretzels & pizza, it's about time I wrote a review.

Every time I come in - the patrons are a little jollier, the tap selection grows more impressive, the pretzels somehow a little bigger and the bartender a little more snarky. I LOVE snarky bartenders in dank, woody brewpubs; The kind that will bitch-slap you for ordering a Sam Adams.

Seriously though, come for the beer. Always some interesting Allagash and Russian River on tap. Try the Odyssey if its available!!
author: Charles N.

description: Great beer selection! One in particular that I really enjoyed was the grapefruit infused beer-wish more places offered this! Pizza was also very good. Just a nice, casual place to go with a mate or a large group.
author: Penny C.

description:
I got to say, as how my friend Johnathan L. puts it, it is a perfect sunny mid-afternoon Saturday in the Mission.  You're pretty much surrounded by everything you could need after, but as far as pizza goes, you can always count on that thin crust always being crunchy.  

The service was also pretty good, and the both times we went, the servers were always helpful with recommendations.  It isn't pretentious, and the crowd varies from college students, yuppies, hippies, and families.  If the demographics this diverse, and they all come to the Pi Bar, then obviously they all agree on the pizza being good.

They open at 3:14 (get it? We didn't when we called...kind of embarrassing), and if you show up, it's an empty house so seating becomes free for all.  In other words, the bigger the group, the earlier you should get there.

Prices are kind of steep, especially if you pile on the toppings, but if you're with a good crowd, and in need of good beer, you'll find that the Pi Bar is worth the money and time.
author: Augustine Y.

description:
Went to the Mission with one of my planned stops being the Pi Bar. 
If you are looking for a great sports bar with loads of TV to watch Sports Ball with an extensive Nacho and stuff menu, then I would skip this place as you will be sad. 
This place does a couple things very well, beer and pizza and they do not try to sell you on the "well we have personal pizza" nonsense. 
A Beer and a slice, $6.28 is a good deal, and they do not give attitude about paying with a credit card (I hate places with oddball prices that with tax its $3.08 and then they are cash only and I think, well I am not coming here again) 
I like the lack of TV's. Every bar does not have to have ten tv's in every direction playing sports center. 
Loved the elephant on one of the doors but I like (as does everybody) elephants.
author: Marcus R.

description:
We stopped here because it was around the corner from where we were staying in San Francisco. Based on other reviews, I'm not sure I would have made a special trip here if we weren't staying so close - but I'm happy we did. Pi's gimmick is fun - opening at 3:14 PM, a special for $6.28 (noted as the pi "r" squared special). Personally, I've never had as much affection for a mathematical constant as the proprietors of Pi seem to have, but still, the implementation is fun.

Also fun: the beer list. Quite a variety here. I had my first sour beer at Pi - and I was glad I did! The prices are a little high - but I suppose that's to be expected considering how rare or special some of their beers are. The $6.28 special is a very good deal. The pizza is okay - but I wouldn't go here just for pizza - there are better slices around.
author: Mike S.

description:
If they didn't close I'd never leave!

This is it ladies and gentlemen.  This is the place we've all fought and died for here in the Mission.  Pi Bar is where it is at.

Best pizza there is.  No, not the best pizza in California. Bigger than that.  No, not the best pizza outside of New York. Screw New York pizza. You heard me! Pi Bar simply has the best pizza there is.  You haven't even had pizza until you've had a slice at Pi Bar.

Their beer selection is fantastic.  They have a amazing selection on tap, and most of these rotate as the weeks go by.  Every time I go in there's something new on the board.  The staff is (gasp!) FRIENDLY and (FAINT!) knowledgable about beer.

I KNOW!

When I ask them a question about one of their new beers on tap, they not only are happy and eager to talk about it, but they actually know what they are talking about.

I KNOW!

Beautiful atmosphere too.  Wood and paneling and all kinds of awesome.  And guess what?  They have music playing...but not so loud that you can't talk to the person sitting next to you.  This means...wait for it...you can actually have a conversation with the people you are eating with.

I KNOW!

Their lasagna is the best I've ever had.  Their salads and appetizers both fresh and affordably priced.  What else can I say.

It's pizza and beer.  What else do you need?
author: Brian L.

description:
I currently boycott only two restaurants in the Mission. Papalote and Pizza Di Mano. Pi Bar is close to getting boycotted. 

A brief background: 
Papalote gives you 4 ounce water cups. They have larger cups available, but they won't give them to you. The problem I have here is Papalote's intention. They don't want you to fill up on free water -- they want to make you thirsty. They intentionally make it hard to satisfy your thirst without buying a drink. I think this is ridiculous, and a bad business philosophy, so.. boycott. 

Pizza Di Mano gave away a coupon that advertised a pizza and a soda for a certain price. When you went to use it, they charged you a higher price, without telling you why. When we asked why, they told us that they can charge whatever they want, regardless of what the coupon says. I think this is lying. So .. boycott. 

Now to Pi Bar. I think they are liars. Last night we went with a group of 5 to have pizza and beers. We orders 5 pretzels, 1 large pie (pi?), and a white slice with bacon. (We had debated getting a white pie, but white pizza gets boring after a bite or two.) Plus, white pie was there Wednesday night special -- "White pie slice, $3.14. Toppings 25 cents." Fast forward to the bill. We get the bill for $138, which included a 20% tip, and find three lines of charges for the white slice: Slice Cheese Pizza: $3.14, White Pie: $0.25, Bacon: $0.25. So, they overcharged use 25 cents, right? Well, when we went to pay for our bill, we asked them about the 25 cents. 

A quick side note: I know it's only 25 cents. We can afford 25 cents. Each persons portion of the bill was $28, so the 25 cents would have made it a nickel cheaper. It's the principal -- they added something to the bill that shouldn't have been there. 

So, their response: "That's just how we write it." Huh? No, I'm sorry, we'll take that off. No, I'm sorry, that's the only way we can punch it into our computer systems. Instead we get them essentially saying, "Oh, we just lie to you about the price of a white slice. It's not actually $3.14 as our menu advertise, it's actually $3.39". This is lying. So... boycott?
author: David H.

description:
Average Pizza, Great Beer

The beer selection is great, atmosphere fun, and wait staff friendly and helpful. 

The pizza is New York-style, thin crust. The crust itself is nothing spectacular, and the pizza as a whole is average to good. Even so, it's a comfy and lively place to hang out with friends while enjoying excellent beer.
author: David S.

description:
Pi Bar has opened in the space formerly occupied by Suriya Thai.  Suriya was one of my favorites so I was gutted to see it go.  But thankfully it 's back in a new location and the bonus is now I have Pi Bar to add to my regular rotation.  This is the best pizza I 've found in San Francisco and beyond that, the experience of the space and the service was just wonderful.

The details.  The place was full, jovial but not too loud, at 7pm on a Saturday.  That said, there was room at the bar so no wait for the two of us.  The bar is a great option.  It's in the center of the room, fun and there's plenty of space for a large pie and drinks without feeling at all crowded.  Great view of the kitchen and the chef tossing the dough for the pizzas. We started with a drink, I had the Lost Coast Great White lager and my partner the Ace Pear Cider.  Both excellent.

When I go to a new pizza place I like to start by ordering a basic cheese pizza. Sort of my baseline measure.  As above, a perfectly blistered, thin, NYstyle pizza.  The herbs and crushed red pepper that come with it are fresh herbs, a nice touch!  Small was more than enough for two.

And there 's still room for dessert. I ordered the "rainbow cookies'. . .sort of domino sized slices of cake in three colors (think Italian flag) with raspberry filling between the layers, glazed with chocolate.  The bartender, Jennifer, was a total star, and "gifted" us with a glass of dessert wine to go with the cookies.  It was a chocolate raspberry port that was delicious, especially paired with the dessert.

All in all, a wonderful evening.  And if you've been to Suriya and mourn it's passing, be heartened that it's back elsewhere, and now we have both it AND Pi Bar.  And checkout the artwork visible to the right of the bar.  The Bartender that gave us that free drink painted a lovely Thai elephant as a tribute to our beloved Suriya.  Cheers to that!
author: Mark N.

description:
Great beer selection, so-so pizza.

They have all sort of interesting brews, such as one sour beer from Russian River (which I absolutely love.. but it's pricey). I also had one beer that was SO strong the point where it felt almost like chugging down a hard liquor. This was about my 5th strong beer of that night, and I actually did not finish it. *gasp* Hell is freezing over!

The pizza was okay, but not great. Thin NY-style.. keep in mind I've never been to NY, but I know I've definitely had better NY-style pizza at other locations.

This is a great place to hang out with some friends over a beer or two and grab a bite to eat at the same time, but I wouldn't come here just to satisfy a pizza craving.
author: Kazu O.

description:
We ordered a pizza and their polenta fries. I was severely underwhelmed and, quite frankly, disappointed that we wasted $26 here, considering the plethora of great pizza locations in the mission. 

The cheese had the texture of rubber, the crust was hard, and even though we got the pizza home within 5 minutes of picking it up, it tasted as though it had been sitting on the counter for 2 days. Not to mention they got our order wrong. 

Their saving grace was the polenta fries, But you only get 9 measley pieces for $6. Hardly worth the price gouge. 

On the other hand, it looked like they had some good beers on tap.
author: harvey f.

description:
This review is strictly for beerweek 2012.  They were featuring beers from the Marin Brewery Company which I was excited to try.  To my dismay the portions were a bit disappointing.  My porter came in small wine-like glass (my guess ~8 ounces), and my IPA came in a slightly bigger glass (my guess 10-12 ounces), but well short of a pint.  So despite being both excellent beers, I just felt like I wasn't getting my money's worth at 6-7 bucks a pop.  The Oakland Ale (not a special for beerweek) I got as my third drink was a pint... so by the end of the night we were trying to figure out which beer selections would yield a full pint!

Also miffed that they didn't have the usual beer and pizza slice special going on this particular night, surely related to beerweek.  I'm sure this place is usually a great spot, guess I'll have to come back to find out.
author: Brian A.

description: The greatest place to have as your corner bar/pizza spot! Having mad cravings for Death by Mushroom pizza and wishing I still lived nearby....
author: Heather M.

description: Reasons to go here: not crowded, exciting beers with a bent towards IPAs, pizza pizza pizza. The Death and Takes mushroom sauce pizza is amazing; add some caramelized onions and olives to that and it becomes special. It's good stuff so is a hair more expensive than I'd want, but that's ok. The bartender also said he'd charge us $0.25 / second to do a keg stand if he could, but that we couldn't do that.
author: David S.

description: My favorite place to grab a slice in the Mission!!!! Super casual atmosphere with delicious beer and attentive service. Not pretentious, good prices, and yummy crispness. Our server was the sweetest I've had while dining out in a long time. Love it!
author: Violet R.

description: $40 for a large pizza with 3 toppings takeout - we picked it up promptly as we live around the corner. The pizza was super oily, sloppy and mushy. Never again. Giant rip off. Disgusting. This Jersey girl will go elsewhere.
author: Lindsay M.

description:
Had another positive experience there, so I'm bumping it to 5-stars.

Ordered a pesto, sausage and balsamic onions pizza the second time. Also got a Caesar salad. Neither was as good as what we ordered on our first visit, but still very solid nevertheless.

This is a great place for an unpretentious pie. Check it out.
author: Nathan C.

description:
This place is just awesome. This pizza is incredible and they have a baller beer selection. I always end up getting real drunk here, which, yes, makes the pizza better, but trust me: This is the best pizza around Noe. They use some special mozzarella made just for them, or at least that's what the lady told me. It's so good I always end up eating the leftovers on the way home. I don't care if it's a fat move. I like being fat for Pi Bar. And drunk, too.

Get a large bacon, mushroom and onion. Eat the rest later, if there is any.
author: Tyler M.

description:
I'll be honest, I've been ignoring the anti-carb craze for years now.  I like bread!  And while I do purchase whole grain stuff in my home, I am no elitist when it comes to the white flour typically used in pizza dough.  The reason is simple: I love pizza!  I really, really love it.  My boyfriend does too, and for a while it seemed like we were headed into dangerous body balance territory with how often we were making pizza a part of our diet.

So we joined a gym and agreed we'd only have pizza once a week: hello, Pizza Sundays!  Our rating system, varying from Yelp's 5 star practice, is the 6 slice matrix--6 slices being amazing, never been better, trickling down to 1 slice, as in "why did I buy this when I could have ordered Domino's."  I think we can generally agree that that is a bad decision, in case I'm not being clear.
