Went in early Dec and the pizza was the blandest and sogginest I ever had, couldn't get the center of it off the pan.They promised great salads and they were lame ones I could get at  diner. I would walk by and read their description as they were remodeling the place and get excited but it didn't match anything I experienced inside once they opened.:(
author: Sion S.

description:
we came here for a team dinner (read: 50 hungry cyclists), and they were very accommodating. they kept the pizzas coming, as well as the pitchers. we took the joint over, and they took it in stride. 

came back with my pops and had  nice quiet dinner, and service was spot on once again. pizza here is delicious and filling, and quite large. the crust is nice and thin and crispy, which is great if it's fresh, but it does not make the reheat journey very well. 

but let's talk about beer. they have it. lots of it. and it's all good. yeah!

go here. go now. yeah!
author: Brooke B.

description: Pi Bar offers great pizza (it really doesn't have to be amazing), great beer (which they keep rotating), (in my experience) pretty good service, and a nice space. Definitely check it out.
author: Heewa B.

description: Had the happy hour special - slice of cheese and a beer for $6.  Also had the polenta fries and a ginger beer.  Everything was delicious and extremely fresh.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Jaclyn M.

description:
OK, so I am new to this review writing thing.  So bear with me.  

Just had dinner at Pi Bar.  And had the best time.  Monday nights you can now go there to hear Ensemble Soulard to hear what they call "Gypsy Jazz & Swing".  Anna sung a totally non-traditional rendition of the classic, "All of Me" that knocked my socks off.  

As allways, the New York style pizza is great.  The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is relaxed.

Will go back, expecially on Mondays.
author: Matthew P.

description:
the hype was right.

service, beer, pizza, spaghetti, beer, ambiance, price. all good, all going to be revisited soon if possible.
author: Ameer N.

description:
Who charges extra for Parmesan cheese? Pi does! 
Who won't make a pizza with 1/2 & 1/2 ingredients? Pi won't! 
Who charges $35 for a pizza that isn't too fabulous?!! You guessed it! 

I'm pretty disappointed.  I LOVE pizza. I eat it way too often. Pi would be great place for me and my friends/family to stop by on the way home from work- but considering what you get for you money and that the pizza is not THAT tasty, I can walk a few blocks for some tastier (and less expensive) treats. I don't mind paying $$$ for a good pie, Pi just doesn't seem to have one. yet. Hopefully, things will improve.
author: Deb N.

description: I like Pi Bar because they keep it simple and serve good pizza and beer.
author: thrasher b.

description: Very tasty pizza, great beer selection, not too pricey. A great addition to the Mission. The service was a little rocky the first couple times I went, but that is part of opening a restaurant and working the kinks out. The most recent visit was perfect.
author: Michael H.

description: Come for the pizza, but stay for the casual ambiance, the great beers, and the awesome staff.
author: Anonymouse C.

description: Yay!!! They finally listened to what their customers have been telling them and added a reasonably priced (and tasty) red wine to their menu! Now that it's possible to go there and have wine with their fabulous pizza (I'm not always in the mood for beer), I will be eating here even more frequently!
author: SL N.

description: Just this past week I was at Pie Bar and my honest opinion I didn't think it was the best pizza place in San Francisco. Let me start with service -friendly and efficient.  There was a little bit of a wait on this night, about 15 or 20 minutes later ( not worth it ) we end up sitting at the bar. The salad (mix greens and so forth ) was less than average and the star of the menu was a big disappointment -it came out very with a very toasty crust borderline burned. But, one thing I did love and that is the beer selection.
author: Ernesto C.

description: Beer selection is great and not that expensive.  Pizza is good; a hybridization between "California" and more traditional NY style.  Crust could use some work; it's often a bit too dry or over-baked.  Service is adequate, but not special, and can be a bit slow.  I like the vibe of the place, although they choose to make it a bit louder than I prefer, even for a place that's half bar.
author: Zachary R.

description: Great pizza, and you feel like you're at a brew pub in Oregon. Very relaxed, unpretentious atmosphere. Living in San Francisco, you forget about how wait staff is so uniformly good looking wherever you go.. at Pi, they're just regular looking people. It's refreshing!  (no offense to any Pi staff who might be reading this)
author: Fonz Z.

description: Delicious beer and good bartending. Don't go for the food ( although you can eat there). Go for the atmosphere. Sit at the bar or at a table and drink some delicious draughts. Sit back, relax and enjoy the quiet in a very busy city.
author: Bada B.

description: Pi Bar has a solid selection of oft-rotating beers on tap, and an impressive list of bottles. Rarely does a place with such good beer also hold its own, food-wise. Pi Bar does, however -- it's become a favorite of  many who live around here, myself included.
author: Louis B.

description: There were pink balloons. That was fun. But, the pizza was just OK. Crispy crust was the highlight, but it needed more sauce.
author: Anu Y.

description: It's all right. Better than Arinell, but that doesn't say much. Wouldn't go out of my way for it. Still looking for good New York pizza....
author: Mark A.

description: After ordering a Pi Bar gift certificate over the phone for my son I knew when I visited San Francisco I'd have to experience the Pi Bar for myself. On Mother's  Day I had the opportunity and I am glad I did. The minute I walked in the door it felt good. Casual atmosphere, great music, not to mention beer, beer and more beer. We ordered a large pizza and large is an understatement. WOW! says it all. This is not your traditional pizza. The taste is truly unique and a welcome change. Our service was great, too! So if it's great music, great beer and and a great pizza you want visit this neighborhood bar.
author: Wendy R.

description: The white pizza is great change from too many toppings!  Less is more!  And Pi  is simply a great change in itself.  Nice finally to find a decent  pizza and great beer selection in a no frills atmosphere --- so tired of trendy, aren't you?
author: Tony S.

description: Its around the corner from my house so I was hoping for the best.  Place is just ok.  Crust is ok.  The pizza is ok.  The selection of beer is ok.  Distance from my house is awesome.
author: ray s.

description: Just the best place to get food and beer in the city!  Beer selection is as good as it gets outside of Toronado and City Beer Store, with good food and friendly staff.  They seem to allway have Russian River beers flowing, including a sour for the last few months.
author: scott t.

description:
christ, people. pizza? it's just there to help you soak up a little more beer so you can try another of their A+++ selection. relax on the pizza. yeah, it's not the greatest ever, certainly not the worst. you can get a burrito and bottle of beer at papalote up the street for $15, or 2 *good* beers and 2 slices at happy hour here for less. 

great selection of bottled belgians. 12 brews on tap that are switched often enough to keep the selection fresh. great, friendly service.

don't go here for pizza. go here for beer. it's a *bar* that happens to offer pizza.
author: Rossa S.

description: Nice beer selection. pizza wasn't horrible but wouldn't stand out in a line up.  we had 2 different servers ask us at least 5 times each "how is everything?" once or twice is fine but too many is just annoying. it felt like they wanted to rush us out of there, as i also noticed a few times them looking over at our tables in a surveying mode.. and the restaurant wasn't even that busy.  so to sum it um... meh spot.  maybe would go back but not dying to.
author: Andrew r.

description: I think this may be turning into my local. It's close. It's comfortable. They are friendly and I like the Cabernet. Pizza is all right. And you can take the kids if you want to - which I suppose means it's a restaurant but if feels like a bar.
author: Eliane W.

description: I concur with a solid 3. Met some coworkers after work there.  The pizza was nothing special.
author: Abby C.

description: I will keep it short and sweet. I love the concept, good beer and good pizza.  My feelings after three visits:  Good beer, so so pizza.  If they work on the pizza a little (mostly the crust recipe) I will be stopping by more often.  Also would be super cool if they brewed their own beer.  Happy our special is really cool.
author: Ted t.

description: We have been here twice in the last four days, once for drinks and once for take-out pizza. It reminds me of a New York pizza bar crossed with an SF beer joint.  It does pretty darn well at both.  Good beer selection & it's the best NY style pizza we've had in San Francisco.  The slices are large, the crust excellent, and the saucy a touch spicy.  That they open at 3:14 and slices cost 3.14?  Delightfully geeky -- even, might I say, tubular.
author: David A.

description: After repeated visits, I've discovered two things: the beer selection is even better now than before and the owners have added a "People hate us on Yelp" sign in the window, which, in my opinion, makes them awesome.
author: Bitter J.

description: Perfect, chill neighborhood spot with good beers on tap. Thin, slightly crispy slices of pizza with a classic selection of toppings. Non-pizza dishes don't stand out, but I love to go here for a slice...
author: John Z.

description: Nice beer selection but below average pizza.  It seems like a good casual meet-up space.  And I love the nerdy name.
author: Carol L.

description: Pizza and beer, who doesn't love that combo? I shared a large pie with pepperoni and sausage.  It was flavorful nicely sized thin crust pizza.  They offer a good selection of beers.  I had the trumer pilsner.  Service was great, very attentive.  I like this place.  Good atmosphere, good food and good beer.  It deserves multiple visits.
author: Audgal G.

description: First a disclaimer. I'm from Chicago and I don't generally like pizza. One or twice a year I eat the stuff but really, it's not something I crave. So you can understand that I went to Pi Bar to please my partner. It was a rainy night and we wanted some comfort food. Pi Bar completely won us over. We shared a medium sausage, mushroom, and caramelized onion pizza and a couple of beers. It was fantastic. We sat at the bar and the woman who waited on us was great. The beers were great. The atmosphere was laid back and unpretentious. I can't wait to go back. BTW, we also has the rainbow cookies which weren't really cookies so much as cake. They were terrific.
author: Lee D.

description:
The place was packed, with little table seating. Nice space otherwise, really opened up from when it was Suriya. Waited an hour and ten minutes after putting my name down for a table for 2, without being seated.  While standing near the bar, had 3 great beers, all on tap: a Sierra Nevada trippel,  a Speakeasy's Hunter's Point Porter. and  a La Chouffe. They have an excellent selection of beers on tap. We almost gave up on eating there, but finally grabbed two chairs at the bar as they were being vacated, so we could try the pizza.  The sausage pizza was good-- though not as good as the best pizza in New Haven, New York, or San Francisco. 

I'll be back once the crowds die down a bit, or when in the mood to have a beer or two while standing. A nice addition to the neighborhood.
author: Dan K.

description: We really want to like this place.  It's close to our house, affordable, has a nice vibe, great beer list, and who doesn't like pizza?  Our gripes: the pizza is often overdone/hard and they're pretty stingy on the toppings.  The staff is fine.  We'll keep going back, but just with lower expectations.
author: Blaine B.

description: This place has a pretty decent and laid back environment.  I do feel the food do need some more work on flavors.  The price point for this place is pretty cheap. You could just get a slice of pizza with 2 toppings for under 5 bucks, which is exactly the same price they charges at Extreme Pizza.  The only thing I have a problem with Pi Bar is the service.  It took more than 15 minutes to have our server take our order after numerous attempts to flag her down.  I will give this place another chance in the future, if I'm in the area craving for pizza.
author: KC K.

description: My end of the mission (south end) has sorely been missing a place like this. They have done a great job with the space and made it very inviting. They have a great variety of beers to go with your pizza and offer some you can't find many other places. Most importantly, the pizza is pretty darn good! You get a lot of pizza for the money if you buy a whole pie. Not sure about slices because we didn't try that. I will definitely be a frequent visitor of Pi. Welcome to the neighborhood. The only reason they are not getting 5 stars is because they have to compete with Little Star.
author: Kara K.

description: I like this place. It saved our asses for some late night food. The pizza is pretty good and the service rocked. Sometimes, if you're lucky, there will be rockstar parking right outside too.
author: R B.

description: great people, nice complementary beer, quite tasty pizza and overall great service! ill be coming back, often and frequent
author: Mauri L.

description: I enjoyed everything about Pi Bar except the pizza.  Service was a bit slow but polite, and the atmosphere was cozy and relaxed.  The pizza though -- you shouldn't brand yourself as a pizza place if you are going to serve up this junk.  The pizza I had was bland, dry, and tough.  The sausage was disappointing; the mushrooms average.  Glancing at some previous reviews, it seems that this "style" of pizza is somehow unassailable, and that for me not liking it, it seems that I don't appreciate this particular "style" of pizza.  Well, fine.  You sad suckers can just enjoy your dry, stale and bland "style" of pizza.  I don't even want to know what other garbage you think is delicious.  And in the Mission especially, its truly a shame to waste your time and money here.  If this place was a bar, I'd give it 4 stars, but as they claim to be a pizza place and make (objectively, goshdarnit!) awful pizza, its getting 2 stars from me.
author: Daryl W.

description:
meh, i don't see what the hype is about. finally went there last night with some friends, who love kids night.
beer selection was great, food...like i said: meh.
i ended up getting the spaghetti and meatballs, and i've definitely had better. wasn't impressed with the food at all.
girlfriend got pizza, and she liked it. 
it was loud, so it was difficult to have a conversation......i'm sure i'll be back, but not any time soon.
author: anett r.

description: The pizza is just not good. Period. End of story. The crust tasted like cardboard. It doesn't matter how many amazing beers your serve or how  good the rest of the pizza ingredients are -- the true test of a pizza is the crust and Pi Bar fails. So sad! I live around the corner and wanted to make this my neighborhood spot. I'm giving an extra star for the phenomenal beer selection.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
I really want to like Pi Bar. I really do. It's two blocks from my home and I love Pizza and beer. However, it just hasn't got it's act together.
I've now given it half a dozen chances to improve since opening and it hasn't. Ok, firstly the two star good points:
1. Some of the staff are quite amenable(however others are pushy)
2. They have a decent beer selection
Now for the bad:
1. The pizza is just not up to snuff. You can get good three dollar slices two blocks away that are much better. On three occasions my crust has been charcoaled, and my topping congealed. I lived in NYC for 5 years and NYC style pizza this not!
2. It's way over-priced and it's happy hour isn't. It's more like 'here's a beer we want to get rid of and a tiny slice of burnt pizza for $6.28'
3. It states it is open until midnight every night. However, I was recently turned away at 10.30 on a Monday saying that 'the kitchen is 'closed' - that is just poor business.
4. Lastly, though the interior is attractive it's design is poor - there are not enough seats
it isn't a bar (too expensive) and it isn't a pizza place (poor pizza). It's like someone put concept before reality here. I am sorry Pi Bar, truly.
author: Matt E.

description: after so much pre-opening hype on Eater this place is really a let down. the whole vibe of the place lacks character, it all seems thrown together like a parents rec room bar. lighting could have been more subdued. the bar itself still had a tacky polyurethane coating on the molding, needs another final sanding, lots of air bubbles making for rough surface. the bar itself is oddly wide and the place still smelled like paint. the pizza was well below average (no chew, no snap, just plain floppy and lifeless). in fact, 12 hours later i still feel a bit queasy from eating just that one cheese slice. the bar service is certainly attentive but was a bit overbearing and strained. i give them credit for setting up in a less trafficked valencia block. there are enough folks who like this place, and pizza, so it should do well regardless of quality.
author: casey c.

description: pretty good pizza, but not the best in town...good quiet place to catch up with friends for a drink.
author: Rob L.

description: Fresh good beer on tap.  Yes please.  Pizza isn't the best, but it hits the spot while drinking. The atmosphere is very cool, and the bartenders are very knowledgeable and friendly.
author: meredith b.

description: With so much good pizza in the neighborhood (little star, delfina, beretta, pauline's, arnell's) it's surprising these guys are attempting to compete with their product. Not bad pizza, but nothing special. Actually, it is bad pizza when compared to the competition: not much flavor, soggy crust, and over cheesed. They do have a nice beer selection. A real step down for the neighborhood from suriya thai.
author: Mark S.

description: the owner/manager was super rude.   busy is no excuse.  i left.  she (the owner) apologized to my friends and bought them a beer.  not worth it.
author: doug w.

description: pizza was unexpectedly pretty good - thin, crunchy crust - but there's not much special about the place unless you like math jokes. nerds...
author: Clover Dan ..

description:
this place belongs in goleta, chico or some place beyond the valencia corridor. 

i'll start by saying they have a decent beer selection.  But where's the wine?  

Another thing missing: toppings.  the choices are redacted like a San Quentin dining hall.   Pizza that simple leaves alot to be desired --esp. in this town. 

one thing front and center in my nose: the cleaning supplies that made it smell like a freshly cleaned bathroom.   Somehow i'll forever more have that smell associated with PI bar. 


total waste of time and money. the former being more precious than the latter.
author: mr g.

description: this bar has really friendly bartenders who are happy to break down any beer questions you have, and their beer selection is great! the downfall is that i found it to be overpriced, you can get one of their beers not on special for $5 but everything else is over the top. this is a pizza place but for the quantity of food you get and the price stopping in for a belgian beers would be my only draw
author: Barbara C.

description: Worse pizza ever!   We thought we would give this place a try since it's in our neighborhood.  We should have left when we could after the lame ceasar salad (I could have made it way better).  The pizza is similar to one from the frozen food section.  Stay away!
author: lola s.

description: I thought the pizza was excellent. Far better than Little Star thin crust. Not as good as Pauline's, but then, nothing is. The beer selection is impressive. My only issue is that there aren't enough tables, and I hate the tall, bar-style tables but I bet that comes in handy later in the evening.

description: We recently moved to the area and this was simply the best and closeest pizza to me. Well done!
author: Joel M.

description: Have been back since the first review and I really like this place. Great beer selection, good wait staff. Try the in house sausage.
author: Meredith H.

description: i've definitely experienced better.  the beer selection is great though.  but the pizza....eh
author: a g.

description: The pizza is great.  The vibe is okay but if you are not a beer drinker the other options are not so great.  Not much table seating so if you are with a group greater than 2 plan on spending a significant amount of time waiting.
author: Cheryl J.

description: without a doubt, pi bar is a nice addition to the neighborhood (and a big improvement over the thai place that used to be here).  the pizza is good - thin crust, but not the cracker-y type crust they have at gialina's or flour & water.  their beer selection is impressive, and they've got a nice looking bar with friendly service.  as others have mentioned, it feels more like a bar than a restaurant, but the pizza and atmosphere are good enough to bring me back.
author: Erin C.

description: Loved this place. Good pizza. Good prices. Great beer selection. And contrary to the listing saying it's not good for kids, they sure were nice to my three year old, who loved it. She said she'd go again.
author: Adam L.

description: Be nice to your customers. If you want to yell at them because you are busy and its crowded, thats cool, just don't expect them to come back. Your beer selection is good but not THAT good.  Booooooo...
author: Pizz D.

description:
i'll start by telling you that this place felt too much like an upscale off-campus pizza pub, so if you're over 30, you may want to stick with pizzeria delfina or gialina if you're seeking the right price/quality/ambience combination. (i only saw three people at most in there who looked over 45!)

about the pizza: organic, local ingredients make me quite happy. that's in line with my values and taste buds. at first bite, the pizza (with toppings!) was good, but what became apparent was that it's simply too dry. pizza for me is about the ratio of ingredients, and the sauce was merely a visual accessory, hardly noticeable to the palate. it wasn't until i was halfway through my second slice that i decided to ask for extra sauce to give it the body it needed. whoa! super tasty sauce. beautiful, but too bad they don't emphasize it.

i had hopeful expectations, and was sadly very very disappointed.
author: d b.

description: I think its a really good pie.  Certainly the best I've found in the Mission.
author: Paul R.

description: Great addition to the 'hood. Nice atmosphere, good service, delicious beers, decent pizza--the pizza gets the job done but it's no Little Star or Delfina Pizzeria, that is for sure. I would go back for a beer (their selection was unique--up there with Monk's Kettle in my book) and/or maybe I'd go for an appetizer (the fried mozzarella sounded good?), but I would not specifically go there for a meal again unless they ramp it up. I do like their commitment to local, organic, sustainably farmed foods....maybe one of the problems is that you choose your own toppings? Seems like a great idea in essence, but I actually find that the combinations are always better when the chef picks them. I prefer to leave it to the experts and just order a combo that's on the menu. So maybe it's best if you ask the server to suggest a combo of toppings that tends to work well? To say the least, i am glad I tried it. I also appreciate that the business owner opened his restaurant on this up-and-coming block. Valencia is undoubtedly gentrifying block by block. They are just getting this biz started, so I am sure they will improve as they receive feedback from customers.
author: Sara W.

description: The tap beer selection is fantastic. Jen is one of the owners and knows quite a lot about beer. I have not checked their pizza, but it looks good. Their special for $6.40 is not with every beer, it is only with one of the taps. I will definitely go back.
author: S C.

description: Went on a pizza tasting tour this evening, first to the new Pi Bar on Valencia in SF where they offered a cheese slice and a beer for $6.28 (2 times the value of pi).  The slice was quite good, NY style, but the presence of a large group with small children (in a bar?) was a bit annoying.  Otherwise it seemed like a nice place, quite adequate in a pinch.  Then over to Berkeley to try the new Emilia's.  The slice option there was much more  appealing because it included onions and sausage instead of just plain cheese, yet was cheaper than the cheese slice at Pi ($3 versus $3.14).  However, I did have to wait 15 minutes while he made a new slice pie, and it seemed inevitable that the waits are going to be a bit long since as far as I could see there was only one person staffing the entire operation.  That aside, the slice was delicious.   All ingredients were first rate and the crust was perfect..
author: David T.

description: I was pretty excited for the opening of Pi Bar, since it's right around the corner from my apartment!  Sadly, I stopped in here a few weekends ago with my bf and we were sorely disappointed.  We both go the slice + beer for $6.28 special, since we were on our way to a movie and didn't want to stay long.  First complaint:  "Can I get mushrooms on my slice?"  The answer was no, even though I offered to pay extra for it.  Really? REALLY???  Really, you don't want to take my money AND please a customer by taking an extra 20 seconds to put some mushrooms on my slice???  Mind you, the place had just opened for the day and we were literally the only people there, so it's not like they could be "too busy" (imo).  The reasoning was that they "just like to keep it simple, and not adjust the price".  Give. me. a. break.   Complaint #2: Bad beer advice.  Bf asked what they had in terms of lighter beer, and our server recommended something that ended up being kind of a dark amber.  I ended up trading him my pilsner.  Complaint #3 (and most importantly):  The food was terrible.  Given that they had just opened for the day, when our food arrived it was clear they had just heated up a few slices from the night before.  Which might have been OK (hey, it's pizza), if the crust wasn't mostly burned and the sauce non-existant.  I couldn't even fold the slice, it was so crisply burned.  I was surprised they would even serve us this food.  Not worth the money, and definitely not worth my time.
author: Vicki M.

description: seems like everyone has been talking about this place and alas it is finally open!  overall not a typical mission crowd- i would say a lot of other neighborhood transplants make their way there at least the night i ventured in myself, but based on the hoopla that might why the diversity has expanded beyond your typical unshowered hipster.  overall good beer selection and i thought the pizza was pretty good but it was my first real meal after my successful survival of what possibly might have been the swine flu - so let's just say I not be the most partial judge. not sure if the typical groupies for the usual suspects of little star, pauline's, tony's, and  flour and water will think it's up to par though.  the wait staff was very accommodating turning the table for 2 into 4 for me and company-proving that they must be good at math to work there.  also you can watch the guys make your pizza reminding me of my childhood pizza place-and might be a nostalgic moment for you too.  it's nice to have a new neighborhood bar in walking distant. will i go back, yes.  did it change my life, no.
author: Kate B.
